sub_title: Starting a new job in September!
summary:
In my work and private life I aim to contribute to a just and sustainable society. That’s simply common sense to me. We owe it to next generations. I care about social and environmental wellbeing, ranging from topics such as food security and sustainable value chains to human rights and climate-smart adaptation. 

I am experienced in programme management, not scared of managing multi-million EUR budgets.

What I like:
- having a leadership role in an international, multi-cultural team
- getting stuff done & seeing the impact

What I don't like:
- lack of vision
- wasting resources
- people who sell nonsense

projects.title: RESILIENCE project
projects.description: Multi-disciplinary and multi-stakeholder project to identify challenges and opportunities for integrated development programming. Core fields: Disaster Risk Reduction, Climate Change Adaptation and Poverty Reduction. Case studies and workshops in Indonesia, Bolivia, Ethiopia and the EU, leading up to the development of a toolkit supporting aid workers and policy makers in their decisionmaking.

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: 
- Overall coordination of multi-annual partnership NLRC-NL MoFA (May 2022-). Pillars: humanitarian assistance and strengthening the humanitarian system. Total 5Y budget: 114M EUR (2022-2026).
- Overall coordination of Response Preparedness II and III Programmes (Feb 2020-), implemented with Lebanese, Mali, Central African Republic, Zambia, Ivory Coast and South Sudan Red Cross and Palestine Red Crescent (Lebanon branch) and technical advise from RCRC Climate Centre and 510. Total 5-year budget: 9.7M EUR (RPII 2016-2021) and 8M EUR (RPIII 2022-2026).
- Overall coordination of Innovative Approaches to Response Preparedness Programme (April 2018-May 2022), implemented with Red Cross National Societies in Kenya, Uganda and Ethiopia with technical support from RCRC Climate Center, 510.data, British Red Cross, 2018-2022. Programme pillars are Forecast-based Financing, Cash in Early Action and Data Preparedness. Total 5-year budget: 10M EUR.
-Ad interim coordination (Sep 2018-June 2019) of 3FM Serious Request international programmes, implemented with National Societies worldwide, ICRC and IFRC. Programmes: Restoring Family Links, Pneumonia, Youth in Conflict, Sexual Violence, WASH and the new campaign themes for 2018: emergency aid in conflict and prevention of natural disasters.

Themes: disaster preparedness, humanitarian aid, disaster risk reduction, WASH, health.

profile_positions.description: Overall coordination of the Response Preparedness programmes (RP and RPII) of Netherlands Red Cross. Focus on the inception period of RPII, with budgeting, grant contracting and organising baseline studies. RPII is focused on strengthening the institutional response preparedness capacity of the Red Cross National Societies in Mali, Central African Republic, Zambia and Lebanon. The innovative approach of Forecast-based Financing is implemented in Mali and Zambia. The programme runs from 2016 to 2020 with technical support from  RCRC Climate Center, 510.data and Netherlands Red Cross. Total 4-year budget of 7.7M EUR.

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilties: project coordination and administration, partner and donor liaison, reporting, acquisition, at Cordaid's business unit for disaster risk reduction and disaster response. Annual project portfolio ~3 M EUR, of which 1,5 M EUR fixed institutional donor projects and 1,5 M flexible funds to be granted to partner organisations and self-implemented projects.

Themes: disaster risk reduction, disaster preparedness, humanitarian aid.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Responsibilities: Communications and PR, workshop and event organisation, general decision-making.

Themes: Lindyhop, charleston, solo jazzdance and other swingdances from the 1920s and '30s.

Swing in Utrecht is a foundation that offers swing dance classes, international workshops, social dances and performances in Utrecht and other locations in the Netherlands. Its main focus is Lindyhop: an Afro-American partnerdance that emerged in New York's jazzclubs in the 1930s. Swing in Utrecht grew from around 30 to more than 300 students over the last few years and is one of the most thriving swingdance communities in the Netherlands.

Responsibilities: shaping and coordinating a team of volunteers, tuning the team's communication strategy to the current needs of the organisation, communications support.

Themes: social innovation, community welfare, curiosity.

SodaProducties is a social business that offers practical solutions for social questions.

Responsibilities: awarenessraising among general public, initiating a 'fair-shopping route' in Utrecht.

Themes: sustainable development, fair trade, organic consumption, responsible behaviour.

Oxfam Novib, member of Oxfam International, is a world-wide development organisation that mobilises the power of people against poverty. Around the globe, it works to find practical, innovative ways for people to lift themselves out of poverty and thrive.
